intro: Nardosmia arctica, commonly known as Arctic sweetflag, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold climates. Its essential oils contain compounds that contribute to its distinctive fragrance. Nardosmia arctica plays a minor ecological role in its environment, providing habitat and food for various insect species.
